AREAS.TITLE: Areas of Impact
AREAS.SUBTITLE: Urban development doesn't happen in isolated parts. It happens when systems connect.
AREAS.TEXT: We work in key areas of urban and territorial development:
AREAS.TEXT_2: Not as independent solutions, but as integrated ecosystems.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Governance
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Digital Government and Transparency.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We integrate strategies to improve and optimize public administration and government processes, while fostering principles of openness and transparency to bring governments, citizens, and businesses closer together based on Information and Communication Technologies.

AREA1.TITLE: Participation and inclusion
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Design of a citizen participation plan for decision-making, project development, and public policies

AREA1.TITLE: Public and social services
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Integration and interconnection of services with access through comprehensive platforms

AREA1.TITLE: Transparency and information accessibility
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Development of tools for information representation and access

AREA2.TITLE: Efficiency in global management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of information and communication technologies in governments to identify problems and build solutions aligned with real scenarios

AREA2.TITLE: Multi-Level Governance
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Organization of functional areas, facilitating the creation of funding programs, regulatory implementation, and forming networks that aggregate demand and enable the introduction of innovative services

SERVICE.TITLE: Digital Single Window
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Development of portals for digitizing procedures (business licenses, property tax, water) reducing corruption and wait times.

SERVICE.TITLE: Citizen Participation Platforms
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Apps or portals for 'Participatory Budgeting' and geolocated citizen reports (potholes, broken streetlights).

SERVICE.TITLE: Transparency Dashboards (Open Data)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Open data portals for citizens to visualize how public funds are spent (mandatory by law in many states).

SERVICE.TITLE: Governmental Cybersecurity
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Protection of sensitive municipal registry data and critical systems.

PROJECTS.TITLE: RANCHO LA COFRADÍA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A 68.1-hectare sustainable development project promoting balanced growth in Tlajomulco. It integrates agriculture, livestock, industry, entertainment, education, and infrastructure areas, utilizing advanced methodologies like BIM and Lean Construction to strengthen sustainable development goals.

PROJECTS.TITLE: COMPREHENSIVE TECHNOLOGICAL SOLUTIONS PROJECTS
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive turnkey project that guarantees connected, secure, and operational spaces. We handle the entire process, from design and planning to final delivery, ensuring each system functions optimally from day one. The solution integrates efficient communication networks, access control, video surveillance, electrical backup, and multimedia tools, optimizing daily operations and ensuring continuity during power outages, as well as equipping rooms for in-person or virtual meetings.

SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.TITLE:
Smart
Economy
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Financing and Business Models.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: We generate development plans that foster the spirit of innovation, creative ability, and capacity for change and transformation.

AREA1.TITLE: Innovation
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Generation of measures to promote and encourage cooperation between administration, businesses, and education

AREA1.TITLE: Productivity
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Generation of physical and technological infrastructures to optimize productivity

AREA1.TITLE: Interconnectivity
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Generation of business networks and strategies to achieve an online presence

AREA2.TITLE: Labor market flexibility
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Creation of measures to improve labor conditions such as combating unemployment, improving access to the labor market, and developing technological proposals

AREA2.TITLE: Entrepreneurship and Start-Ups
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Education, training, and creation of environments and infrastructures focused on business support

SERVICE.TITLE: PPP (Public-Private Partnerships) Scheme Management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Consultancy to structure projects where private investment recovers capital in the long term

SERVICE.TITLE: ESCO (Energy Service Company) Models
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Implementation of projects that 'pay for themselves' with the generated savings (e.g., switching to LED, energy efficiency in water pumping)

SERVICE.TITLE: Pure and Financial Leasing
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Offer of infrastructure as a service (OpEx) to prevent client de-capitalization (cameras, streetlights, fleets)

SERVICE.TITLE: International Fund Management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Advisory services to access 'Green Bonds' or funds from organizations like the IDB or World Bank for modernization projects

PROJECTS.TITLE: ROSEWOOD RESIDENCES MAYACOBA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: An exclusive residential and tourist development in the Riviera Maya, comprising three large-scale private residences with luxury finishes and custom furniture. The design integrates materials and details that harmonize with lagoons, golf courses, and mangroves, offering privacy and connection with nature. The project combines elegance, comfort, and a unique natural environment within a gated community.

PROJECTS.TITLE: XHALATA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Xhalata is a 16-hectare tourism and real estate development integrating residences, commercial spaces, and wellness areas in harmony with the natural environment. Inspired by the UN SDGs, it incorporates renewable energy, water management, reforestation, and biodiversity protection. It promotes an inclusive and resilient community, focused on tourism and sustainable development.

PROJECTS.TITLE: MOLINOS DE SALVATIERRA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: 157 LOTS AND 29 HOUSES

PROJECTS.TITLE: INDUSTRIAL WAREHOUSE
PROJECTS.LOCATE: Manzana 003, Ejido de Tequisitlan, 56020 Tequisistlán, Méx.

Infrastructure

SERVICE.TITLE: Remote-Managed Public Lighting
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Streetlights that automatically report failures and allow dimming (lower intensity) during low-traffic hours to save energy.

Smart
Environment
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.SUBTITLE: Sustainability and ESG Services.
SMART_ECOSYSTEM_ITEMS.DESCRIPTION: Providing guidance in the development and implementation of clean energy, the efficient use of water, and waste management, based on proper project management and sustainable use of natural resources.

AREA1.TITLE: Environmental and distribution network monitoring
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Supervision of environmental conditions and the status of distribution networks.

AREA1.TITLE: Energy efficiency
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Optimization of energy consumption to reduce costs and emissions.

AREA1.TITLE: Urban planning and building rehabilitation
AREA1.DESCRIPTION: Design and improvement of urban spaces and recovery of existing infrastructure.

AREA2.TITLE: Waste management
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Integrated waste handling to minimize environmental impact.

AREA2.TITLE: Environmental protection
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Actions to preserve ecosystems and natural resources.

AREA2.TITLE: Awareness and behavior change
AREA2.DESCRIPTION: Promotion of sustainable practices and environmental education in society.

SERVICE.TITLE: ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) Consulting
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Help industrial parks and cities comply with regulations to attract foreign investment.

SERVICE.TITLE: Water Management (Smart Water)
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Telemetry for wells, sectorization of potable water networks to detect non-visible leaks (vital given the water crisis in Mexico).

SERVICE.TITLE: Net Zero Strategy
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions inventory and decarbonization plans.

SERVICE.TITLE: Air Quality Monitoring
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Networks of environmental sensors to automatically activate contingency protocols.

SERVICE.TITLE: Smart Waste Management
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Level sensors in containers and optimization of collection routes to reduce fuel consumption.

PROJECTS.TITLE: XHALATA
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Xhalata is a 16-hectare tourism and real estate development integrating residences, commercial spaces, and wellness areas in harmony with the natural environment. Inspired by the UN SDGs, it incorporates renewable energy, water management, reforestation, and biodiversity protection. It promotes an inclusive and resilient community, focused on tourism and sustainable development.

PROJECTS.TITLE: TEPOZTLÁN
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A sustainable real estate development of 9.7 hectares integrating 68 low environmental impact homes. The project applies LEED principles, water reuse, renewable energy, and modular construction. Inspired by the SDGs, it includes wellness spaces, bike lanes, and sports areas, as well as commercial and community areas that promote social cohesion and respect local identity.

PROJECTS.TITLE: HACIENDA CAPULÍN
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A residential and tourist development of 66 luxury apartments that combines conscious design and sustainability, aligned with the UN SDGs. Integrated into a privileged natural environment, it preserves centenary trees and maintains historical architecture. It offers amenities like a swimming pool, paddle tennis courts, jacuzzi, and restaurant. It uses sustainable technologies and practices to optimize resources and minimize environmental impact.

SERVICE.TITLE: Structural Health Monitoring

HERO.TEXT_1: GLACI is an urban innovation consortium that integrates talent, multi-sector collaboration, and financial structuring to turn urban visions into sustainable, viable projects with real impact.
HERO.TEXT_3: We align governments, the private sector, academia, investors, and multilateral organizations to structure and materialize sustainable urban projects, with a human vision and financial solidity.
HERO.TEXT_4: Cities don't evolve with just ideas, technology, or resources. They evolve when the right talent, conscious collaboration, and well-structured capital move in the same direction.

ABOUT.LABEL: Smart City.
ABOUT.TEXT1: A holistic system where human and social capital interact, employing solutions based on ICTs.
ABOUT.TITLE2: The purpose of a Smart City is to achieve efficient management
ABOUT.TEXT2: meeting the needs of the city and its citizens.
ABOUT.TITLE3: Consulting and advisory services in smart city management
ABOUT.TEXT3: National and international services with an ethical, sustainable, and innovative focus.

CONTACT_FORM.HEADING: Contact us if you have questions or comments about the topic, or register to receive more information about smart cities.

INFORMATION.MISSION_TEXT: To devise intelligent solutions for the technological and sustainable development of cities and communities, always seeking the inclusion and accessibility of people.
INFORMATION.VISION_TEXT: To develop and create city projects and human settlements worldwide that promote inclusivity and guarantee accessibility, security, resource optimization, affordability, and sustainability to achieve prosperity and quality of life.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Smart City – Smart Communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
GLACI Smart Cities, Smart Future accompanies the management and implementation processes of solutions based on ISO regulations.

These allow for the objective evaluation of the development of sustainable cities and communities, through process standardization and qualitative and quantitative analysis.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT: The International Organization for Standardization, through its technical committee 268 for sustainable cities and communities, has developed the following Standards in this field of application.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development in communities - Management system for sustainable development
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
Its main goals are:

  • Build consensus on sustainable development
  • Improve the sustainability, smartness, and resilience of all its actions
  • Develop intersectoral, multidisciplinary, life-cycle value, and total costing approaches.
  • Foster synergies
  • Increase the efficiency and attractiveness of communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scope:

  • Applicable to communities of all sizes, structures, and types
  • Applicable to developed and developing countries
  • Applicable at local, regional, or national levels
  • Applicable in urban or rural areas

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development of communities – Indicators for city services and quality of life
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
This standard complements the series of indicators for measuring performance in communities; it includes city services and quality of life in smart cities and resilient cities.

These indicators allow for evaluation and, in turn, planning based on possible future needs and establishes as main goals:

  • Measurement of service performance management and quality over time
  • Possibility of comparison to learn about performance measures
  • Development of policies and setting of priorities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scope:

  • Indicators that can be aggregated to very large administrative areas
  • Applicable to the evaluation of city resource efficiency
  • Together with other indicators, it allows for a more comprehensive and holistic approach to sustainability analysis

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable cities and communities - Indicators for Smart Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
It presents a benchmark for city sustainability, which requires additional indicators beyond those established to evaluate city services and quality of life. Together with the application of the ISO 37120 Standard, it helps cities implement policies, programs, and projects for smart cities.

Scope:

Together with the ISO 37120 standard, it aims to provide a complete set of indicators to measure progress toward a smart city.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Its goals are:

  • Apply collaborative leadership methods
  • Use data information and technologies to provide service and quality of life improvements
  • Provide a better living environment based on smart policies and making technologies available to citizens
  • Generate innovative solutions to environmental and sustainability issues
  • Identify needs and benefits of smart infrastructures
  • Facilitate innovation and growth
  • Build a dynamic and innovative economy that can be resilient

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable Cities and Communities – Indicators for Resilient Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
A resilient city is capable of preparing for, recovering from, and adapting to shocks and stresses. This standard, together with the indicators outlined in the ISO 37120 standard, allows for the evaluation of Resilient Cities and also taking actions to manage and mitigate human and natural stress related to environmental degradation and economic instability that cause persistent negative impacts.

It presents specific indicators and also presents indicators structured according to a risk management and disaster management process; monitoring compliance with Sustainable Development Goals and structured in accordance with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction. These aim to help cities:
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
• Prepare for, recover from, and adapt to shocks and stresses
  • Generate learning based on the comparison of performance measures and sharing good practices.


Scope:

  • Applicable for measuring resilience in cities
  • Applicable to any city, municipality, or local government
  • Applicable regardless of its size or location

REGISTER_INFORMATION.TITLE:
Do you need
information?
REGISTER_INFORMATION.SUBTITLE:
At GLACI
we are at your service.
REGISTER_INFORMATION.TEXT: If you are interested in learning more about the topic or if you have any questions or suggestions, we invite you to fill out the registration form with real data so we can communicate correctly and provide you with the tools and information you need.
REGISTER_INFORMATION.WARNING: * Rest assured that your data will be handled securely.

FORM.TITLE: register to request information about a topic of interest.
FORM.SUBTITLE: Your registration helps us send you the necessary data you request.

GLACI.TITLE: What it is
GLACI.TEXT_1: GLACI is an interdisciplinary talent consortium that drives urban and territorial projects by integrating innovation, knowledge, governance, and financial structuring.
GLACI.TEXT_2: We work where complexity requires collective intelligence, institutional sensitivity, and long-term viability.

CARDS.TITLE: Deep understanding
CARDS.TEXT: We listen to the territory, its actors, and its real context.

CARDS.TITLE: Co-creation and structuring
CARDS.TEXT: We align sectors and design solid technical and financial structures.

CARDS.TITLE: Responsible materialization
CARDS.TEXT: We accompany execution with governance, metrics, and continuity.

WORK.TITLE: Who We Work For
WORK.TEXT: Governments with a long-term vision and a sense of legacy. Companies committed to sustainable development. Academia and knowledge centers that provide rigor and applied innovation. Investors and multilateral organizations that prioritize impact, transparency, and viability.
WORK.TEXT_2: Our approach aligns with international standards and best practices for sustainable and smart cities, prioritizing governance, indicators, transparency, and continuity.

CONSORTIUM.TITLE: Consortium
CONSORTIUM.TEXT: GLACI is a consortium formed by professionals, organizations, and strategic partners with real experience in urban development, infrastructure, sustainability, finance, and knowledge.
CONSORTIUM.TEXT_2: We believe that major urban challenges are not solved from a single sector.
CONSORTIUM.TEXT_3: They are solved through conscious collaboration.

GOVERNANCE.SUBTITLE: Lasting transformations begin with clear decisions, trustworthy institutions, and shared data.
GOVERNANCE.TEXT_1: GLACI articulates actors and structures projects to sustainably strengthen urban governance.
GOVERNANCE.TEXT_2_1: We work so that governance is:
GOVERNANCE.TEXT_4_1: We have accompanied urban and territorial projects where governance was key to ensuring continuity, trust, and measurable results.

TEAM.TITLE: Talent
TEAM.SUBTITLE: Behind every project there are people.
TEAM.TEXT_2: Our team combines knowledge, judgment, and responsibility.

TEAM.NAME: Osvaldo Mireles
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in technology and sustainable development with a specialization in Smart Cities, BIM, Blockchain, AI, and the New Urban Agenda.

TEAM.NAME: Jorge Moreno
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in disruptive technologies, MIT Certified. 13 years leading innovation in smart cities, IoT, and sustainable projects.

TEAM.NAME: Angel Luis Tendero
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Architect and project manager. A reference in architecture, he has been featured on the cover of ABC, El Mundo, and El País for his career.

TEAM.NAME: Tania Sánchez
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Senior architect and urban planner with national and international experience. Specialized in sustainable urban design and planning.

TEAM.NAME: Héctor Miranda Martínez
TEAM.SEMBLANCE: Expert in land road construction with extensive experience in planning, execution, and quality control of infrastructure projects in the public and industrial sectors.
